DOC.brief_title: Electrical Stimulation Patients With Prolonged Mechanical Ventilation
DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE : Muscle atrophy diaphragm dysfunction common complication patient prolong mechanical ventilator ( PMV ) associate increased rate weaning failure day hospitalization . Electrical stimulation ( ES ) show beneficial patient severe chronic heart failure chronic obstructive pulmonary disease . The purpose study examine effect ES skeletal muscle function , pulmonary mechanic hospitalization outcomes patient PMV . METHODS : Patients mechanical ventilator 21 day recruit respiratory care center ( RCC ) . All subject randomly assign three group : ES abdominal muscle ( ES-Abd , n=30 ) , ES brachial biceps ( ES-bicep , n=30 ) sham group ( Sham ) . Subjects group receive ES muscle 30 min/session , 2 sessions/day 10 day set except area ES . The muscle function assess skin-fold thickness muscle strength . The pulmonary function assess : lung compliance , airway resistance , tidal volume , minute volume maximal inspiratory pressure . The hospitalization outcome follow patient discharge RCC . The outcomes variable include : weaning rate duration , mortality , day ventilator , length RCC stay .
